title: GR tells SLPP dissidents he’s agreeable to interim administration
body_lines: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has said he is agreeable to setting up an interim administration to address the economic problems faced by the country , former president Maithripala Sirisena said.
He and several others representing the 11 party alliance as well as a group of SLPP dissidents met with the president this morning to discuss their demand for an interim government .

Sirisena said the president has agreed to set up such an administration if all parties agree to it with a new prime minister and cabinet but this is contrary what he told a group of SLPP MPs he met on Thursday night when he said the PM can continue in office.
